title: State heal phase since 6 days on mainnet
body:
#### System information

Geth version: v1.10.25
CL client & version: e.g. prysmaticlabs/prysm-beacon-chain:v3.1.1
OS & Version: Linux
Commit hash : 

#### Expected behaviour

Execution client fully synced.

#### Actual behaviour

State heal in progress since 6 days.

#### Backtrace Execution client:


Any idea if it's correct? Execution client is in heal state since 6 days.

If it's been healing for six days, then I'd call it "uncertain" if it will ever finish. 
The good news, though, is that we have made multiple fixes on `master` that makes snap-sync perform better, in particular the state-heal phase. 

So please upgrade to `1.11..`, a.k.a `latest`, which is available through docker or our official [downloads page](https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads/)
ok, but because I have this problem on mainnet, it is secure to upgrade eth to development version?

Security-wise there should be no difference. 

Stability-wise, one can normally expect the 'latest' to be less stable, more experimental, than 'stable', However, since you are currently unable to sync / operate on 'stable', that shouldn't be a concern for you. I mean, it can't be worse than not functioning, can it?
Yes, you are right. I will update my client to the latest version.

I'm also having this same issue. About 4+ days now. 

I did experience a system crash though. This is my first time having issues with geth after several years of use (except for that one bad release you guys put out recently).

I built from current master and restarted geth and my node fixed itself within 2 hours. (since the last comment)

I was in the same state as OP (log output identical)

I'm guessing https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/456b1878928c75aae3f42e9f9c98a7ccd1a25666 was the fix? Either way thanks @holiman
